job_title: Certified Veterinary Technician in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great staff and team to work with. I have never had any issues with the coworkers there.
cons: Management is everything and it could make or break a business. Management here is very bad and they could care less about their employees as they look out for one another, but only when it is convenient for them. I would not recommend working here if you want to feel like you truly matter as a worker. If you value yourself as an individual, you could do much better than this place.

review_title: Good place to work if you like a fast pace

review_title: Great place, but most employees have to work two jobs
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Culver City, CA
pros: I respect all the medical staff for the service they do for pets and their owners.  ACCESS really does have the most talented group of veterinary doctors and technicians and for that, I was very honored to have worked along side them.    The facility itself is beautiful and equipped with the most up to date medical equipment.  Shifts were 10 hours a day, 4 days a week.  It was nice to have 3 days off and schedules were pretty flexible.
cons: Pay was horrible for the amount of work one is expected to do.  Even though the work environment feels lax, it can also feel hostile at times when emotions are running high.  ACCESS is an emergency and specialty animal hospital so emotions are usually all over the place.  Be prepared to be thrown in to the mix right off the bat without much training.  Lunches are only 30 minutes and parking makes no sense for an emergency hospital.

pros: I don't know what the deal is with anyone unhappy. Try working anywhere else and then come to ACCESS, you'll see! Super generous management staff got the front desk staff shirts for Client Care week that look like band shirts... Called them all rock stars. For tech week we got super hero capes - no kidding! Every one of us zoomed around the hospital with our capes flying proud! Personalized coffee mugs, letters hand signed by the owner, I mean truly, you couldn't feel more loved than when your owner arranges for you to have arcade games rented for you during staff celebration days!
cons: Yes, there are long hours. Long days do happen and they happen a lot. And it's not an understaffing thing, it's just that So many clients love the hospital that it keeps growing like crazy. Good problem to have I suppose, but it's hard on staff sometimes (though at least you feel appreciated for the time you put in!).
